title: Cognitive Load Assessment of Anatomy E-Learning Tools: Application of the Dual-Task Paradigm

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Research-based educational program analyzing the scientific impact of e-learning tool interfaces on cognitive load, amid increased use due to reduced anatomy lab hours.

learning_goals: Learners can quantitatively measure cognitive load in anatomy e-learning tools using the Dual-Task Paradigm.
Learners can explain how to overcome the limitations of the traditional Dual-Task Paradigm by applying the Modified Stroop Test.
Learners can compare and analyze differences in cognitive load between two commercial anatomy e-learning tools based on experimental data.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
